translation.text: Delays in both directions due to a freight train requiring mechanical repairs at Wyee earlier & currently signal equipment repairs near Hawkesbury River. Please allow plenty of additional travel time, listen to announcements, check information screens as some stopping patterns and departure platforms may change at short notice

Hunter Line services have been suspended in both directions due to severe weather conditions causing flooding at Sandgate and between Maitland and Dungog/ Scone. 

A limited number of buses are replacing services between Newcastle Interchange and Maitland, Dungog/ Scone, however you are advised to avoid any non-essential travel or to make your own arrangements. If you must travel please allow plenty of additional travel time.

For further information please listen to announcements, check information screens and transport apps.

Some services travelling towards the City are delayed by up to 20 minutes additional travel time due to a train requiring mechanical repairs at Gordon. Please listen to announcements, check transport apps and information screens as some stopping patterns and departure platforms may change at short notice.

Please allow up to 20 minutes additional travel time due to a train requiring mechanical repairs at Gordon. Train stopping patterns and departure platforms may change at short notice. Please listen to announcements and check station information screens before boarding trains.
Be weather wise and avoid rushing and stepping in puddles to prevent slips, trips and falls.

NRL: Eels V Storm-  Bankwest Stadium, Parramatta
20:00 to 22:00
- The closest station to Bankwest Stadium is Parramatta. The stadium is approximately 15 minutes walk from the station exiting via Darcy St then continuing on Church St, the Riverside Walk (non-accessible route) or through Prince Alfred Square to the stadium on O'Connell St.

Summer in the Domain - The Domain, Art Gallery Road
17:00 to 22:00
- The closest stations to The Domain are Martin Place, St James and Circular Quay which are within walking distance of the Domain.

For more information visit https://transportnsw.info/events/2021/03
due to a freight train with mechanical problems at Wyee earlier & currently signal equipment repairs near Hawkesbury River

If possible please avoid any non-essential travel or make your own arrangements. If you must travel please allow plenty of additional travel time.

due to an operational issue. Buses have been arranged to replace trains between Katoomba & Penrith in that direction, with the first buses due to arrive Katoomba station at 5:20 PM.

due to an operational issue. Customers for the Blue Mountains Line stations, please board the 3:18 PM Lithgow service to complete your journey.
The lift between platforms 1/2 and Burwood Road is temporarily out of service. For assistance, please see station staff or call 9563 7578.
The lift between the concourse and Station Street is temporarily out of service. If you require assistance, please ask staff or call 9563 7273.

From 11 January to end-December 2021, the escalators and staircase connecting the corner of Pitt Street and Eddy Avenue with the Grand Concourse and L1 Light Rail stop will be closed due to station upgrade works. 

To access the Grand Concourse and Platforms 1 to 12 from the street level, please use the Western Forecourt entry via Pitt Street. To access Platforms 16 to 25 from the street level, please use the Eddy Avenue entry. 

To access Pitt Street or Eddy Avenue from the Grand Concourse or L1 light rail stop, please exit the station via the Western Forecourt or Northern Concourse.

There are changes happening at Central Station due to Sydney Metro construction works. Access to certain areas of the station and platforms may mean using different stairs, escalators and lifts. Please follow the signs and staff directions. If you need assistance, see station staff. For detailed information please visit https://transportnsw.info/alerts/details#/6049959
Due to station redevelopment work some platforms have reduced capacity. Please avoid standing in front of construction zones and remain behind the yellow line on the platform

Platforms 4, 5 & 6 upgrade works. A new Metro concourse is being constructed on the northern end of Sydenham Station. While the concourse is being installed, please board and alight from the first 5 carriages of the train on platforms 4 & 6 and the last 6 carriages of the train on platform 5. If you need help, please ask staff at the station. For more information on these upgrades, please see sydneymetro.info
